page.title: 14Whitbread Estate
page.content: The Whitbread family have been the major landowners in the Parish since 18th Century, with records dating back to 1314, referring to their connection with the area. A large percentage of the farmland in the square is part of the Samuel Whitbread Estate. This Estate comprises 10,800 acres in all, of which 1,000 acres are woodland, 6,500 acres are let land with 1,900 acres in hand. There are twelve main let farms plus one partnership and a few additional small holdings. Included in the main tenancies is the Bedfordshire County Council who own approximately 1,000 acres which they let for small holdings. There is also a newly opened "pick your own"farm and shop situatedon the A600 Bedford to Hitchin Road. Both fruit and vegetables are available here.
